page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY KIBWORTH contd
page.content:
{OLD HARCOURT contd.
There was also a lot of open space for safe animal grazing. There has never been much industrial activity here. The village economy was always based on agriculture.
{THE WINDMILL
The Windmill, a local landmark on the Langton Rd., was probably built about 1650, and was in use until the 1920s.It is now fully restored by local fund_raising under the care of the society for the protection of Ancient Buildings, and is in working order. It is a fine example of a Post Mill, and in 1711 the miller, Daniel Hutchinson, carved his name on the huge centre oak post.
